channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for LA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for LA

item.title: Report X-2023120295
item.description:
Report X-2023120295

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-22T18:12:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-01
  • City: ALEXANDRIA
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: THE HAZMAT WAS LOADED AT THE BACK OF THE TRAILER, AT THE BELLY, LOADED ON IT'S SIDE, BELT WAS STOPPED, PKG WAS PLACED IN A HAZMAT TOTE AND MOVED TO A VENTILATED AREA DescribePack: THE CAPS DIDN'T COME OFF, DUE TO THE PACKAGE BEING LOADED ON IT'S SIDE SOME OF THE LIQUID LEAKED OUT FROM THE TOP, ABOUT 1 OR 2 CUPS DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A HAZMAT TOTE, LINED WITH A HAZMAT BAG, MOVED TO A VENTILATED AREA

item.title: Report E-2023120262
item.description:
Report E-2023120262

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-21T18:11:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-08
  • City: GARYVILLE
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: HONEYWELL INTERNATIONAL INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On the afternoon of 12/08/23 at 13:56, a team of drivers attempted an offload at the facility in Garyville, LA.  During the initial leak check, there were vapors visible from the nitrogen plug. Instructions given to tighten the plug, was attempted and were able to tighten by one full turn of the plug. Leak path still existed. Manager consulted with Tech Services, HF Operations and Dangerous Goods.  Decided to involve third-party emergency response company to evaluate and remedy the situation to make the tanker road worthy for the trip back to origin site.

item.title: Report E-2023120201
item.description:
Report E-2023120201

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-18T21:10:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-01
  • City: GARYVILLE
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: HONEYWELL INTERNATIONAL INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: When trailer arrived at customer site it was observed wisping from the PRV. Customer site operators installed a cap on the PRV. Cap inspected by third party. Courtesy notification to Louisiana State Police (23-05965) on incident. Area supervisor of Louisiana State Polis provided verbal approval of movement back to site of origin (Geismar) for repair.

item.title: Report E-2023120111
item.description:
Report E-2023120111

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-15T21:09:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-07
  • City: PORT ALLEN
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While unloading a pallet of waste from a trailer at Veolia's ten day intransit facility, a Veolia employee heard a pop and realized the forks on the forklift were protruding out of the back of the pallet and punctured a 15 gallon 1H1 drum of flammable liquid located on the pallet behind the one he was moving. Approximately 100 ml of the material leaked out before the hole closed on itself. The employee moved the forklift away from the area and shut it off, then proceeded to contain the spill with absorbent. The employee and the Veolia site manager then donned correct PPE and promptly overpacked the container and cleaned up the spill area.

item.title: Report I-2023120036
item.description:
Report I-2023120036

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-22T18:12:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-21
  • City: Kenner
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: DELTA AIR LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Delta received notification on 11/21/23 of an undeclared event where a UN0276(Cartridges, power device(squib)) shipped undeclared from Atlanta to New Orleans airport. There were five parts in total located in the shipment; one of which was hazmat. The original order for this shipment was for four non-hazmat parts. When packaging this box, the agent used recycled packaging material from a nearby recycling bin. The affected cartridge was intermixed within this bin. When the employee used the recycled packaging material, the cartridge was intermixed and unknowingly placed in the box. Flight#: DL2224 Date: 11/21/2023 AWB: 006-80159914 The event is under investigation to determine root cause and subsequent corrective actions. See the attached pictures.

  • Description: Approximately 3 gallons of diethanolamine was able to leak from the KAG Specialty Products Group, LLC tank trailer due to a mis-threaded cap. ES&H Environmental responded and handled the remediation.
